realExamples.title: Roblox Game Developers â€” Kids Making Crazy Money
realExamples.description: A famous crypto Twitter personality highlighted how Roblox developers (some of them kids) are making massive amounts of money. AI now lets anyone build games on the platform, dramatically lowering the barrier. This is the App Store gold rush of 2009 all over again â€” people laughed at 'fart apps' while some kid made $1M.

realExamples.title: Web5: Bitcoin-Based Decentralized Internet

Users run apps on personal Bitcoin nodes, earn sats routing traffic, verify identity cryptographically against AI fakes. 'You become the internet.' deepDives.title: Agent Commerce â€” Where It's Going & How to Participate
deepDives.subtitle: The 4-layer stack forming NOW + 3 concrete entry points

layers.name: Layer 1: Payment Rails (NOW)
layers.description: Agents can pay. 140M+ transactions processed via x402. Currently settling mainly in USDC on Base (Coinbase L2). But x402 is payment-rail agnostic â€” it supports any token on any chain. The next evolution: Lightning Network + Spark (Lightspark's Bitcoin L2) bringing near-zero fees and instant settlement.
layers.players: Coinbase (x402 + Base), Lightspark/Spark (Lightning rails), Google (AP2), Cloudflare (NET Dollar)
layers.detail: Coinbase builds BOTH sides: x402 (protocol) + Lightspark (rails). When Spark enables stablecoins on Lightning, x402 routes agent payments through BTC rails. Full convergence forming.

layers.name: Layer 2: Identity (NOW)
layers.description: Agents need on-chain identity so other agents know who to trust. ERC-8004 gives each agent a verifiable identity + reputation score. Like a business license for bots.
layers.players: The Graph (ERC-8004), Edge & Node (ampersend wallet)
layers.detail: Without identity, agents can't build trust. This is the prerequisite for everything above it.

layers.name: Layer 3: Discovery (3-6 months)
layers.description: Agents need to FIND each other. Agent marketplaces â€” like an app store but for agent services. "I need a translation agent" â†’ browse, check reputation, pay per use. This is the Shopify-for-agents opportunity.
layers.players: Google Cloud, ServiceNow, Agent.ai, AI Agent Store (no winner)
layers.detail: Whoever owns discovery owns the agent economy. This is the distribution problem. A great niche API means nothing if agents can't find you.

layers.name: Layer 4: Orchestration (6-12 months)
layers.description: Complex workflows where agents hire other agents. Your "CEO agent" breaks a task into subtasks, finds specialist agents, negotiates prices, hires them, verifies output. A full autonomous supply chain.
layers.players: LangChain, CrewAI, AutoGPT (no dominant winner)
layers.detail: This is the 'operating system' of the agent economy. The middleware deciding WHICH APIs to call, in what order.

keyInsights.label: Little Guy Advantage
keyInsights.text: Agents are pure meritocracy machines. No brand loyalty, no enterprise sales cycles. If your niche API is 5% better, agents switch instantly. This inverts the traditional startup disadvantage.

keyInsights.label: Reputation = The Real Prize
keyInsights.text: Infrastructure layers build bottom-up: connectivity (x402) â†’ discovery (registries) â†’ TRUST (reputation). We're between step 1 and 2. Step 3 is the Google PageRank moment.

deepDives.recommendation: Start with Entry 1. Pick one thing you already know well (Alessa copy, Meta Ads optimization, product categorization) and expose it as an x402 API on Cloudflare. Learn the plumbing, start earning micropayments from agents, and build a concrete foundation.

discoveryLayers.name: Agent Registries / Marketplaces
discoveryLayers.description: Think of it like an "App Store for APIs." Your agent searches "translate BGâ†’GR fashion terms" and gets ranked results. Whoever owns this registry owns the distribution â€” that's a billion-dollar position.
discoveryLayers.players: Google Cloud, ServiceNow, Agent.ai, AI Agent Store
discoveryLayers.detail: Currently most agents are HARDCODED by developers â€” like the 1995 internet where you typed exact URLs. No discovery layer. This is the gap.

discoveryLayers.name: Reputation Scores
discoveryLayers.description: Agents will pick APIs based on: speed, accuracy, price, uptime. All measurable, all automatable. An API that's 95% accurate at 0.01Â¢ beats one that's 92% at 0.05Â¢. The little guy wins on quality in a niche, not on brand.
discoveryLayers.detail: Pure meritocracy. No brand loyalty. This is the Google PageRank moment for the agent economy.

discoveryLayers.name: Protocol-Level Discovery
discoveryLayers.description: x402 already embeds pricing IN the HTTP request. Imagine if APIs also advertised their capabilities the same way. An agent hits your endpoint, reads "I do BGâ†’GR fashion translation, 98% accuracy, 0.02Â¢/request" and decides on the spot. No marketing needed.
discoveryLayers.detail: This is 'SEO for agents' â€” make yourself discoverable without human docs.

discoveryLayers.name: Word of Mouth... Between Agents
discoveryLayers.description: This sounds crazy but it's already happening on Moltbook. Agent A uses your API, rates it high, Agent B sees that rating and switches. Viral distribution without a single human involved.
discoveryLayers.detail: Agent reputation networks could become the most powerful distribution channel ever.

playbook.title: The Little Guy's Playbook
playbook.intro: The irony: the little guy actually has an ADVANTAGE because agents don't have brand loyalty. They're pure meritocracy machines. If your niche API is 5% better, the agent switches instantly â€” no sales calls, no enterprise contracts, no relationships.
steps: Pick a niche so specific that Google won't bother (fashion translation, Bulgarian competitor pricing, Alessa-style product descriptions)
Be measurably better in that niche â€” agents don't care about your brand, they care about benchmarks
List on every agent registry that exists (the equivalent of SEO for agents)
Price aggressively â€” at fractions of a cent, volume is everything
Make your API self-describing â€” so agents can discover what you do without a human reading docs

deepDives.title: Bitcoin â€” The Settlement Layer of the Agent Economy

layers.name: The Problem: Agents Can't Use Banks
layers.description: AI agents can't open bank accounts, pass KYC, or get credit cards. They're completely locked out of traditional finance. They need a permissionless, programmable money layer that doesn't require human identity verification.
layers.detail: This isn't a temporary gap â€” it's structural. Traditional finance requires human identity. Agents will NEVER have that. They need a native financial system.

layers.name: Layer 1: Bitcoin (The Vault)
layers.description: Pure savings. Cold storage. Generational wealth. This is your "central bank reserve" â€” except you're your own central bank. Fixed supply (21M forever), verifiable on-chain, no counterparty risk with self-custody.

layers.detail: Erebor = first nationally chartered bank built for AI+crypto+defense stack. OCC approval in 4 months, FDIC in 5 (record speed). No product yet, no website â€” pure founder network play. Plans: stablecoin integration, crypto-collateralized loans, API-first banking.

discoveryLayers.name: What Dies: Fractional Reserve Banking
discoveryLayers.description: Today: deposit 100 Ğ»Ğ² â†’ bank lends 90 â†’ that person deposits â†’ bank lends 81 â†’ repeat. Your 100 Ğ»Ğ² becomes ~1,000 Ğ»Ğ² across the system. Banks earn interest on 10x the real deposits. EU reserve ratio: 1% (= 100x theoretical multiplier). US: 0% since March 2020.
discoveryLayers.detail: The banking system's profit model: earn interest on created money while paying depositors below inflation. Your deposit loses 5-10% purchasing power/year while banks generate 10x leveraged returns. Bitcoin makes this impossible: fixed supply, proof-of-reserves, transparent on-chain verification.

discoveryLayers.name: What Replaces It: Full Reserve + Honest Credit
discoveryLayers.description: Banks match savers with borrowers directly. You choose: "keep my BTC in the vault" (0% yield, full custody) OR "lend my BTC out for 3% APY" (counterparty risk, you're told exactly who borrowed it). No mixing the two. Smart contracts enforce terms automatically.
discoveryLayers.detail: Credit becomes scarcer and more honest. Interest rates reflect REAL supply and demand, not central bank manipulation. Saving is rewarded (deflation) instead of punished (inflation). The losers: governments funding deficits via money printing. The winners: savers, builders, anyone producing real value.

discoveryLayers.name: Agent Banking: x402 Meets Erebor
discoveryLayers.description: AI agents need bank accounts too. They earn micropayments (x402), accumulate stablecoins, convert to BTC, manage their own treasuries. Erebor's API-first approach is built for exactly this â€” banking for machines.

discoveryLayers.detail: The convergence: BTC as base money + Lightning as rails + x402 as agent payments + Erebor as institutional custody = the full stack for autonomous machine commerce with sound money.

The model: hold BTC as reserve asset â†’ issue liabilities (stocks, bonds, convertible notes) against it â†’ institutions get BTC exposure without holding BTC â†’ use leverage to acquire more BTC. 24/7 Wall St projects Strategy could pass 1 million BTC by 2027.

deepDives.layersTitle: The Agent Economy Stack â€” From Discovery to Trading

layers.name: Layer 1: Discover (Clawstr + NIP-90)
layers.description: Clawstr = Nostr-powered social network for AI agents. Agents post to "subclaws," debate, rate services, tip each other via Lightning Zaps. Think Reddit but every user is a bot. layers.detail: The discovery+social layer. Without this, agents can transact but can't find each other or build reputation. Clawstr launched early 2026, already has active AI agents posting with #clawstr tags. Agents get Lightning addresses in format npub@npub.cash.

layers.description: Agents rate services, debate quality, build track records on Clawstr. This creates a trust layer â€” how Agent A knows Agent B's translation service is good. Nobody has built a formal reputation SCORING system yet â€” this is the "Google PageRank for agents" opportunity.

layers.description: Agent posts job request on Nostr â†’ specialist agents bid â†’ winner gets hired â†’ paid in sats via Lightning. Like Upwork but permissionless, decentralized, and settling in Bitcoin.
layers.players: Nostr protocol (NIP-90 spec), various agent frameworks
layers.detail: Already functioning at small scale. Agents can advertise: "I do BGâ†’GR fashion translation, 98% accuracy, 0.02Â¢/request." Other agents hire them on the spot. No human docs needed.

layers.name: Layer 4: Pay (L402 / x402)
layers.description: L402 (Lightning Labs) = HTTP 402 â†’ pay via Lightning â†’ get macaroon auth token. BTC-native, permissionless, open source. lnget = automatic L402 for AI agents. Open-sourced Feb 11, 2026. x402 (Coinbase) = HTTP 402 â†’ pay via USDC on Base. 50M+ transactions. Stripe integrated. layers.detail: The payment layer is the MOST mature piece. L402 came first (~2023), x402 scaled faster (Coinbase+Stripe distribution). The competition between them mirrors Visa vs cash â€” both will likely coexist.

layers.detail: Agents need bank accounts. They can't open Chase accounts or pass KYC. Agentic Wallets solve this permissionlessly. Combined with ERC-8004 identity standard, agents get verifiable on-chain identity + wallet.
